results.title: Orthostatic hypotension due to quinidine and atenolol.

citations.NLM: Manolis AS, Estes NA 3rd. Orthostatic hypotension due to quinidine and atenolol. Am J Med. 1987 May;82(5):1083-4. PMID: 3578348

results.title: The effects of atenolol (tenormin) and methyldopa on simple tests of central nervous function.
results.text_hl: Two identical studies, one comparing the effect of single doses of a new beta-adrenoceptor blocker, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Tenormin@@@) (50 mg and 100 mg) and placebo, and the other comparing the effect of single doses of @CHEMICAL_Methyldopa @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008750 @@@methyldopa@@@ (250 mg and 500 mg) and placebo, in healthy volunteers, were carried out. 2 In both studies the effect of the drugs upon reaction time, critical flicker frequency, subjective drowsiness, pulse rate and blood pressure was measured. 3 @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ produced no effect upon reaction time, critical flicker frequency or subjective feelings, while @CHEMICAL_Methyldopa @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008750 @@@methyldopa@@@ produced a statistically significant prolongation of reaction time and a statistically significant increase in the subjective sensation of drowsiness. 4 @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ produced statistically significant @<m>DISEASE_Hypotension_Orthostatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007024 @@@reductions in systolic and diastolic blood pressure@@@ and in pulse rate while @CHEMICAL_Methyldopa @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008750 @@@methyldopa@@@ was without effect. 5 It is concluded that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ is unlikely to produce the side effects of sedation or drowsiness.

citations.NLM: Bayliss PF, Duncan SM. The effects of atenolol (tenormin) and methyldopa on simple tests of central nervous function. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1975 Dec;2(6):527-31. PMID: 9954
citations.BibTeX: @article{9954, title={The effects of atenolol (tenormin) and methyldopa on simple tests of central nervous function.}, author={Bayliss PF and Duncan SM}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={2}, number={6}, pages={527-31}}

results.title: Drug treatment of orthostatic hypotension because of autonomic failure or neurocardiogenic syncope.
results.text_hl: In @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Hypotension_Orthostatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007024 @@@orthostatic hypotension@@@ associated with @DISEASE_Syncope_Vasovagal @DISEASE_MESH:D019462 @@@neurocardiogenic syncope@@@, clinical trials have demonstrated that beta-blockers, especially beta(1)-selective agents without intrinsic sympathomimetic activity such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Midodrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008879 @@@midodrine@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Paroxetine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017374 @@@paroxetine@@@ can decrease recurrence of @DISEASE_Syncope @DISEASE_MESH:D013575 @@@syncope@@@.

citations.NLM: Lamarre-Cliche M. Drug treatment of orthostatic hypotension because of autonomic failure or neurocardiogenic syncope. Am J Cardiovasc Drugs. 2002;2(1):23-35. PMID: 14727996
citations.BibTeX: @article{14727996, title={Drug treatment of orthostatic hypotension because of autonomic failure or neurocardiogenic syncope.}, author={Lamarre-Cliche M}, journal={Am J Cardiovasc Drugs}, volume={2}, number={1}, pages={23-35}}

results.title: Different hemodynamic effects of celipropol and atenolol in patients with mild to moderate hypertension.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Celiprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017272 @@@Celiprolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ lead to a similar and significant @<m>DISEASE_Hypotension_Orthostatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007024 @@@reduction of systolic and diastolic blood pressure@@@ (p < 0.005).

citations.NLM: Saner H, Seiler A, Mahler F. Different hemodynamic effects of celipropol and atenolol in patients with mild to moderate hypertension. Arzneimittelforschung. 1995 Jul;45(7):790-5. PMID: 8573224
